title: Rooster weathervane
text: This handmade weathervane rested proudly atop a barn in Red Hook, New York, until it was purchased in the 1970s.  Cut from sheet copper, it was then riveted and wired together.  The original surface was later painted, resulting in the crackled patina.
description: two-sided flat legless rooster; red, yellow and black pigments; openwork tail wired together; central vertical rod extends through body
creditline: Gift of John and Elizabeth Driscoll
